results.title: The Discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production Paris
results.brief_description: The efforts of a group of friends to dine together are continually frustrated in this often hilarious surrealistic fable. As if in a dream, things go awry for all the characters in this, Luis Bunuel’s deliciously comical and brilliantly performed masterpiece. Co-written by Bunuel and Jean-Claude Carriere. English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production Paris

results.title: Nuovo Cinema Paradiso
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Franco Cristaldi, TRE, Radiotelevisione Italiana, TFI, Cristaldifilm and Ariane
results.brief_description: Tornatore’s loving homage to the world of movies. A celebration of cinema - its mystery, its fascination and its capacity to make us laugh, cry and dream. Through the eyes of the adult Toto, we relive his childhood and adolescence in the small Sicilian village of Giancaldo, and especially his relationship with Alfredo (Philippe Noiret) the Cinema Paradiso’s gentle and wise old projectionist. Hidden together high up in the projection box, they grow to share a special love of movies that outlives Toto’s rocky path to manhood. Hailed worldwide by critics and the public alike, this film is a glowingly warm tribute to the innocence of childhood, the anguish of first love and the emotional power of the cinema. English subtitles.

results.title: Heat and dust
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: A young English woman journeys to India to explore the mysterious and scandalous past of her Great-aunt sixty years ago. Both succumb to the beauty of the land and its people and become pregnant. Nevertheless, they remain outsiders in a land they can never fully comprehend. Stars Julie Christie, Greta Scacchi and Madhur Jaffrey.

results.title: The Hotel New Hampshire
results.creator_credit: Tony Richardson, Neil Hartley and Woodfall Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is a fascinating, largely successful adaptation of John Irving’s 1981 novel of the same name. The tale concerns an eccentric New England family that, spurred on by an ever-searching father, establishes a new hotel in locale after locale which mutates in the process. It is a bizarre and whimsical tale starring Rob Lowe and Jodie Foster in the role of brother and sister and Natassja Kinski as a girl so insecure that she hides most of the time inside an enormous bear suit.

results.title: Stand and deliver
results.creator_credit: Ramon Menendez, Tom Musca and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Edward James Olmos gives a widely-acclaimed performance as Jaime Escalante, a dedicated Maths teacher at a Los Angeles high school where most of the inner-city students are underachievers and come from poor Latin American families. Escalante refuses to see them as losers and cajoles, pushes and inspires his class to become Maths wizards and to pass a national exam which no student of the school has ever passed before. With Lou Diamond Phillips and Andy Garcia.

results.title: Slaughterhouse five
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Paul Monash and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Kurt Vonnegut, an American P.O.W. is slipping into mental illness. Now a suburban optometrist, he has space/time fantasies, shifting between his experiences as a POW, including the bombing of Dresden, his life on another planet and his actual life. Michael Sacks plays Billy Pilgrim in a film shot in Czechoslovakia and Minnesota, which captures the complexity of Vonnegut’s work, and the despair of mental illness

results.title: Les Diaboliques
results.brief_description: A sadistic headmaster at a private boy’s school is murdered by his long suffering wife and his brutalised mistress (Simone Signoret). But when the two women return to the school and pretend no knowledge of the headmaster’s disappearance they are unsettled by the schoolboys’ sightings of his “ghost”. Clouzot’s famous horror film is imbued with a dark, malevolent atmosphere and perversity seems to lurk behind every corner. On its release the film was justly celebrated as an innovative contribution to horror filmmaking, and though much of Clouzot’s staging has been copied by subsequent generations of horror filmmakers, few have managed to equal the chilling power of the original. Based on the book “Celle qui N’Etait Plus” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac (who also wrote “Vertigo”).

results.title: Yesterday, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica and Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Concordia, Paris
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni appear in three separate stories. In the first, Adelina (Loren) is a blackmarket slum marketeer who remains permanently pregnant in order to escape a jail sentence, much to the consternation of her exhausted husband (Mastroianni). In the second, Anna, the elegant wife of a rich Milan industrialist, meets her lover for a secret rendezvous. In the third, Mara is a call girl having an affair with a Bologna playboy. Saucy entertainment from two of the best actors to come out of Italy, this film confirmed Loren’s and Mastroianni’s success as international sex symbols. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Le Grand chemin
results.creator_credit: Jean-Loup Hubert, TFI, Selena Audio Visuel, Flach Film and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in France in 1958, a boy is reluctantly sent to the country to stay with relatives. The boy’s guardians are the rough, alcoholic and violent carpenter called Pelo, and his gallant, fatalistic, protective wife Marcelle. Their broken marriage means that each reacts to the child differently; to Pelo, he is a surrogate son and to Marcelle, he is an outlet for her maternal instincts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Loup Hubert, TFI, Selena Audio Visuel, Flach Film and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Passion fish
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, Sarah Green and Atchafalaya Films Inc
results.brief_description: Mary McDonnell is May-Alice, star of a popular day-time soap, who was on her way to a leg waxing session when she was knocked down by a mad taxi-driver. Now confined to a wheelchair, she has only one option left - to return to the Bayou she so defiantly left as a sassy teen. Hiding out in the house of her long dead parents, May-Alice becomes the patient from hell, terrorising a series of nurses and driving each and every one of them from the house. Then Chantelle, a no-nonsense nurse from Chicago, arrives. Chantelle couldn’t be more different than May-Alice and it seems she too will be given her marching orders. Then, unexpectedly, differences are put aside, secrets emerge, old friends drift into their lives and each finds an unlikely romance as they give themselves up to the forces of fate and friendship. Brilliant performances by the cast make this film a rewarding and worthwhile experience.
